title: Finite Automata
description: A finite automaton (also known as a deterministic finite automaton or DFA) is a finite-state machine that will either process a string of symbols and accept (by outputting a 1 or finishing on the 'accept' state, for example) or reject (by outputting a 0 or by failing to finish on an 'accept' state). To the right is a state diagram of a finite automaton that can take either a string of 'a's and 'b's as input. If this string is exactly 'abba', the DFA shown will accept. Otherwise, it will reject. We can start on the initial state, q0.
